articles.headline: Foreseeing Trouble in Exporting Natural Gas
articles.snippet: Gas producers see profits in exports, but Andrew Liveris, chief of Dow Chemical, wants to block what he considers a squandering of a national resource, and a hit to his bottom line.
articles.abstract: Gas producers see profits in exports, but Andrew Liveris, chief of Dow Chemical, wants to block what he considers a squandering of a national resource, and a hit to his bottom line.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIDLAND, Mich. — As Dow Chemical’s chief executive, Andrew N. Liveris has made himself into something of an outcast among his fellow business leaders.
articles.byline: By Clifford Krauss and Nelson D. Schwartz

articles.headline: Sony and Viacom Reach Tentative Deal to Stream Cable Channels
articles.snippet: The agreement is believed to be the first of its kind between a major programmer and any of the technology giants that are trying to disrupt traditional modes of TV delivery.
articles.abstract: The agreement is believed to be the first of its kind between a major programmer and any of the technology giants that are trying to disrupt traditional modes of TV delivery.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a deal that may signal the start of a new era of competition for entrenched cable and satellite providers, Viacom has tentatively agreed to let its popular cable channels — like Nickelodeon and MTV — be carried by an Internet TV service that Sony is creating.

articles.headline: U.S. to Bring Gas Mileage Rules to Era of Hybrids
articles.snippet: The Environmental Protection Agency said it would update its labeling rules to resolve disparities among the growing number of hybrid and electric vehicles on the market.
articles.abstract: The Environmental Protection Agency said it would update its labeling rules to resolve disparities among the growing number of hybrid and electric vehicles on the market.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Federal regulators are planning changes to vehicle fuel-economy ratings after the Ford Motor Company said Thursday that it was cutting the miles-per-gallon rating on one of its popular hybrid models.

articles.headline: Vermont Sisters With Roots in News Embrace Small-Town Papers
articles.snippet: Three twenty-something daughters of a 5th-generation newspaper family have thrown themselves into the business, and the papers they run have thrived.
articles.abstract: Three twenty-something daughters of a 5th-generation newspaper family have thrown themselves into the business, and the papers they run have thrived.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIDDLEBURY, Vt. — King Lear’s three daughters had their lands and loyalties to fight over. Jane Austen’s Dashwood sisters had the prospect of marriage to occupy them, and Anton Chekhov’s three sisters had local military officers to brighten their days.

articles.headline: Easy Credit Dries Up, Choking Growth in China
articles.snippet: Growth has slowed, causing an increase in defaults on unconventional loans, chronic overcapacity in many industries and other problems.
articles.abstract: Growth has slowed, causing an increase in defaults on unconventional loans, chronic overcapacity in many industries and other problems.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHENMU, China — As the Chinese economy boomed, few cities soared faster or higher than Shenmu, a community of nearly 500,000 in northwestern China.

articles.headline: Blood and Chaos Prevail in Egypt, Testing Control
articles.snippet: Egypt erupted into chaos on Friday, raising doubts about the authorities’ capacity to maintain order, as opponents of the military takeover fought security forces and civilians in the street.
articles.abstract: Egypt erupted into chaos on Friday, raising doubts about the authorities’ capacity to maintain order, as opponents of the military takeover fought security forces and civilians in the street.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — Egypt erupted into violent chaos on Friday, raising doubts about the new authorities’ capacity to maintain order, as Islamists and other opponents of last month’s military takeover fought security forces and their civilian allies in street battles across the capital and other cities.

articles.headline: For Airlines, It May Be One Merger Too Many
articles.snippet: Three airline mergers had gained approval since 2008, but the Justice Department has hardened its stance with a proposed union between American and US Airways.
articles.abstract: Three airline mergers had gained approval since 2008, but the Justice Department has hardened its stance with a proposed union between American and US Airways.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shareholders and employees of American Airlines and US Airways may well be wondering: why us?
